column4: anybody know how i can add vista to grub bootloader, vista is on drive c:
if you are about to install ubuntu, it will automatically detect and add vista to grub
if not, you can just find the vista partition number and add it to your /boot/grub/menu.lst
sorry, yup meaning it cant support loading vista direct
neoloader?? doesnt ring a bell... anyway if its a menu option and you dont have a clue what it is, you can delete it
is it commented? if it is then just leave it, its just a kind note for your sake
find a tool to hexedit raw drives first
then just change what you need to change.. eg restore a backed up header or whatever
youd have to be superman to be able to read the hex for the assembly code that it is, nobody will help you with that. you just need to replace the header with a backup or something
if the header is corrupt, and you have no backup, youre stuffed..
